content.description:
Climb along right-trending ledge, then up to a big hole. Stem through the hole. Stay right after the hole to not end up on Hang-One, as the bolt lines are close. 

 Watch for rock-fall being lowered or when you pull the rope.

 Like all routes at Sunnyside, the start of this route is the hardest, so stick-clipping may be warranted.
content.protection: 8 bolts. Anchor bolts with chains, one non-locking carabiner and one steel hook.
content.location: 3rd bolted line from the left, 2nd from the right. Look for the big hole in the wall when you step back from the wall. The route starts down and left from that.

content.description: Thin face moves lead to a grassy ledge, where you mount the slick slab and pull the crux to easy climbing.
content.protection: 8 bolts. Anchor bolts with chains and carabiners.
content.location: Furthest right route. Start just left of the obvious undercling.

content.description: Fun moves up good holds. Was easier until Tait cleaned it. Might be longest climb at Grapefruit.  Easy, relaxed and well protected route that is great first lead climb.  All around fun route. If you stay to the right at the bottom, it is likely harder than a 5.8.
content.protection: 10 bolts. Anchor bolts with chains and carabiners.
content.location: Furthest left bolted line at Sunnyside. Lowest belay station.

content.description:
Start on blank face left of broken hole in the wall, in front of the 3rd belay pad from the right. Careful footwork will find you the mono-pocket up and left of the first bolt. Continue to traverse up and left for 2nd and 3rd bolt and then back right through easy climbing for 4th and 5th bolts to a headwall. Clip the bolt before going over. Move through bouldery section at 5.10b to reach anchors.

 Warning: The crux of this route is definitely through the first two bolts, so if you are not comfortable leading at this grade, a stick-clip is warranted to prevent decking.
content.protection: 9 bolts. Anchor bolts with rings and two steel carabiners. Nice to be belayed over the edge at the top to set up TR. TR can be set up from the top of Sunnyside Up.
content.location: 2nd bolted line from the the left. 2nd flat belay station from the left.

content.description:
WARNING: This is a newly developed area with lots of loose rock. CLIMBER AND BELAYER SHOULD WEAR A HELMET WHEN CLIMBING HERE. 

 Some of the longest climbs at Grapefruit on medium quality, south-facing rock. Developed in 2017-18 by Tom Ellis, Mike Raukhaus, Andy Sterns and Tait Chandler. It's a new area, so all the routes have a fair amount of loose rock on them (despite hours of cleaning). Pitch in by sending often! All routes are bolted and have chains and carabiners at the top (can be accessed for TR). All routes have flat belay stations.
